gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਨਗਰ ੲੇਕ ਹੋਤ ਹੈ ਅਨੇਕ ਹਾਟੈ ਗਾਹਕ ਅਸੰਖ ਅਾਵੈ ਬੇਚਨ ਅਰੁ ਲੈਨ ਕੳੁ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Nagar Ayk Hot Hai Anayk Haatai , Gaahak Asankh Aavai Baychan Aru Lain Kau ?
translation: Just as a town has many shops which are visited by many customers who go there to buy or sell their merchandise.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਪੈ ਕਛੁ ਬੇਚੈ ਅਰੁ ਬਨਜੁ ਨ ਮਾਗੈ ਪਾਵੈ ਅਾਨ ਪੈ ਬਿਸਾਹੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਦੇਖੈ ਸੁਖ ਨੈਨ ਕੳੁ
transliteration: Jaapai Kachhu Baychai Aru Banaju N Maagai Paavai , Aan Pai Bisaahai Jaai Daykhai Soukh Nain Kau ?
translation: When a customer who has sold something at a shop is unable to buy something from there since it is not available, he visits other shops. Finding his requirements there, he feels happy and relaxed.

gurmukhi: ਜਾ ਕੀ ਹਾਟ ਸਕਲ ਸਮਗ੍ਰੀ ਪਾਵੈ ਅੳੁ ਬਿਕਾਵੈ ਬੇਚਤ ਬਿਸਾਹਤ ਚਾਹਤ ਚਿਤ ਚੈਨ ਕੳੁ
transliteration: Jaa Kee Haat Sakal Samagree Paavai Au Bikaavai , Baychat Bisaahat Chaahat Chit Chain Kau ?
translation: A shopkeeper who keeps all types of commodities in his shop and which are sold frequently, a customer generally likes to sell or purchase from there. He feels happy and satisfied.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਜਾਹਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਸਾਹ ਸਰਬ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਲੈਨ ਅਰੁ ਦੈਨ ਕੳੁ ||੪੫੪||
transliteration: Aan Dayv Sayv Jaahi Satigur Pooray Saaha , Sarab Nidhaan Jaa Kai Lain Aru Dain Kau ?454?
translation: Similarly, if a follower of other god comes to the refuge of the perfect True Guru, he will find that his store-house is filled with all types of trading commodities (of loving worship).  (454)
